text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that goods from third countries to Northern Ireland, if it can be proven that the goods are intended to remain in Northern Ireland, are only subject to the UK tariff rate. The candidate answer discusses goods from Great Britain being subject to checks if at risk of entering the EU, and states that goods from third countries (like China) are subject to the same rules as goods from Great Britain. It does not explicitly state the condition that if it can be proven the goods are intended to remain in NI, they are only subject to the UK tariff rate, which is a key element of the Green Lane/Red Lane distinction for goods arriving directly into NI from outside the UK/EU area under the Framework.", "criterion_id": "31ba07bc-6e8b-4a21-b24c-b747c1641530"}
